fields.name: Checkerboard Biscuits
fields.description:
STEP 1
Line a baking sheet with baking parchment. Lightly dust a clean work surface with flour and divide the dough into two. Beat the red food colouring into one batch of dough in a bowl using electric beaters until it’s vibrant red. Divide both lots of dough into two pieces each and chill them for 15 mins.

STEP 2
On the dusted work surface, roll out into four 1cm-thick rectangles, keeping them as straight-edged as possible – a dough scraper or palette knife can help with this. Lay the sheets of dough on top of each other, alternating colours and chill in the fridge until firm, around 30 mins. Trim the edges and cut into strips 1cm thick, then lay the strips on top of each other, alternating the colours, so that a red strip sits on top of plain and vice versa, and brushing lightly with a bit of water to help them stick. Put on a baking tray and chill in the fridge for 1 hr.

STEP 3
Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and line two large baking sheets with baking parchment. Using a very sharp knife, cut into squares and lightly brush the edges with water. Dip the edges in the demerara sugar then arrange on a baking tray. Bake for 8-10 mins until golden and set. Leave to cool on the tray for 10 mins, before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Will keep in an airtight container for three days.

fields.name: Crunchy Cornflake Chicken
fields.description:
If baking, preheat an oven to 180°C (350°F)
In a bowl, add the flour and season lightly with salt and pepper. Mix slightly.
Add the eggs to a separate bowl and beat together.
Lastly, add the crushed cornflakes to a third bowl.
One by one, first coat the chicken in the flour, then into the eggs and lastly in the cornflakes.
The chicken should be well covered in the cornflakes, once done, put to the side.
Repeat until you’re out of chicken.
Place on a lightly greased baking tray and bake for 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked all the way through. Turning halfway through cooking will help guarantee they will cook evenly.
Serve & Enjoy.

fields.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
fields.description:
STEP 1
Put a large saucepan on a medium heat and add 1 tbsp olive oil.

STEP 2
Add 4 finely chopped bacon rashers and fry for 10 mins until golden and crisp.

STEP 3
Reduce the heat and add the 2 onions, 2 carrots, 2 celery sticks, 2 garlic cloves and the leaves from 2-3 sprigs rosemary, all finely chopped, then fry for 10 mins. Stir the veg often until it softens.

STEP 4
Increase the heat to medium-high, add 500g beef mince and cook stirring for 3-4 mins until the meat is browned all over.

STEP 5
Add 2 tins plum tomatoes, the finely chopped leaves from ¾ small pack basil, 1 tsp dried oregano, 2 bay leaves, 2 tbsp tomato purée, 1 beef stock cube, 1 deseeded and finely chopped red chilli (if using), 125ml red wine and 6 halved cherry tomatoes. Stir with a wooden spoon, breaking up the plum tomatoes.

STEP 6
Bring to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and cover with a lid. Cook for 1 hr 15 mins stirring occasionally, until you have a rich, thick sauce.

STEP 7
Add the 75g grated parmesan, check the seasoning and stir.

STEP 8
When the bolognese is nearly finished, cook 400g spaghetti following the pack instructions.

STEP 9
Drain the spaghetti and either stir into the bolognese sauce, or serve the sauce on top. Serve with more grated parmesan, the remaining basil leaves and crusty bread, if you like.

fields.name: Salmon and Lentil Stuffed Bell Peppers
fields.description:
Cook lentils and flake salmon.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil.
Mix lentils, salmon, sautéed onions, and garlic.
Stuff bell peppers with the mixture.
Bake until peppers are tender.

fields.name: Oats and Banana Breakfast Smoothie
fields.description:
Blend oats until fine.
Add bananas, Greek yogurt, and milk to the blender.
Blend until smooth.
Sweeten with honey if desired.

fields.name: Chocolate Banana Muffins
fields.description:
Mash bananas and mix with sugar, eggs, and milk.
In a separate bowl, combine flour and baking powder.
Mix wet and dry ingredients, fold in chocolate chips.
Pour into muffin cups and bake until golden.

fields.name: Spinach and feta Omelette
fields.description:
Whisk eggs and season with salt and pepper.
Sauté spinach in olive oil until wilted.
Pour eggs over spinach, add crumbled feta, and cook until set.
Fold and serve.

fields.name: Greek Yogurt and Berry Parfait
fields.description:
Layer Greek yogurt, sliced strawberries, sliced bananas, and granola.
Repeat layers.
Drizzle with honey and serve.

fields.name: Lentil and Vegetable Soup
fields.description:
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil.
Add diced carrots, celery, and tomatoes.
Pour in vegetable broth and add lentils and spices.
Simmer until lentils are tender.

fields.name: Pizza con Pollo
fields.description:
1.
Crumble the yeast and dissolve it in 200 ml of lukewarm water. Process the flour, yeast water, 3 tablespoons of oil and 1 teaspoon of salt with the dough hook of the hand mixer to a smooth dough. Cover and in a warm place Let rise for approx. 1 hour.
2.
Peel the shallot and cut into fine pieces. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a saucepan. Sauté the shallot in it for 1–2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cover Simmer for about 6 minutes over low heat. Season with salt, pepper and sugar. Clean, wash and blanch in boiling salted water for about 2 minutes, drain and drain well3.
Wash the meat, pat dry. Season with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan. Fry the meat in it, turning over a medium heat, for about 8 minutes, remove. 2–3 minutes before the end of the cooking time, drizzle the meat with 1 teaspoon of pesto
4.
Roll out the dough on a floured work surface in a round shape (approx. 26 cm Ø). Place the dough on a baking sheet lined with baking paper and brush with the tomato sauce. Cut the mozzarella into slices. Top the pizza with snow peas and mozzarella. Bake in a preheated oven (electric stove: 200 ° C / convection: 175 ° C / gas: see manufacturer) for about 10 minutes
5.
Wash the rocket and drain well to let. Take the pizza out of the oven. Thinly slice the chicken. Spread the rocket and chicken slices on the pizza and drizzle with a little pesto
6.
Wait approx. 35 minutes

fields.name: Honey Glazed Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
fields.description:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a small bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, and Dijon mustard.
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet and brush them with the honey glaze.
Toss diced sweet potatoes and halved Brussels sprouts in the remaining glaze and spread them around the salmon.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roast in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Serve the Honey Glazed Salmon with Roasted Vegetables over a bed of quinoa.

fields.name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
fields.description:
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped spinach to the pan and cook until wilted.
Butterfly each chicken breast and stuff them with the sautéed spinach and crumbled feta.
Secure the stuffed chicken breasts with toothpicks, if needed.
Season the stuffed chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove toothpicks before serving.

fields.name: Oats and Banana Pancakes
fields.description:
In a blender, combine oats, mashed banana, eggs, milk, baking powder, and cinnamon. Blend until smooth.
Heat a griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour pancake batter onto the griddle, forming small pancakes.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side.
Serve with maple syrup and sliced bananas.

fields.name: Strawberry Yogurt Popsicles
fields.description:
Blend strawberries, Greek yogurt, and honey until smooth.
Pour the mixture into popsicle molds.
Freeze until solid.
Unmold and savor these refreshing Strawberry Yogurt Popsicles.

fields.name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.description:
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until the mixture is light and fluffy.

Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.

In a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt.

Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing just until combined.

Fold in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using) until evenly distributed throughout the dough.

Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

Bake in the preheated oven for 9 to 11 minutes or until the edges are golden but the centers are still soft.

Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.

Enjoy these classic chocolate chip cookies with a glass of milk or your favorite beverage!

fields.name: Spaghetti code
fields.description:
Start by creating a new file with a misleading name to keep everyone guessing about its purpose.

Sprinkle unclear variable names generously throughout the code. Use single-letter variables for added confusion.

Mix inconsistent indentation thoroughly. Feel free to use a combination of spaces and tabs for that extra flavor.

Add unnecessary comments sparingly. Place them randomly to distract anyone trying to understand the logic.

Peel redundant code blocks and scatter them across different sections. Make sure to include functions that are never called.

In a separate bowl, blend global variables until they are indistinguishable from local ones.

Season with overly complex conditional statements. Nest them to create a labyrinth of logic.

Unravel the nested loops and intertwine them in a way that makes it impossible to trace the program flow.

Spritz obscure function calls generously. Bonus points for functions defined in other files.

Garnish with a dash of magic numbers and a heap of code copy-pasted directly from Stack Overflow.

Bake the code in the hottest coding environment available, ensuring that it's nearly impossible to debug.

Serve the Spaghetti Code surprise to your unsuspecting colleagues or successors. Watch as they attempt to refactor and understand the tangled masterpiece.
